00001 #include <screen/screen.h>
00002 #include <terminal/terminal.h>
00003 #include <stdlib.h>
00004 #include <mm/virt_mm.h>
00005 
00006 //The VGA Frame buffer starts at 0xB8000
00007 static uint16* video_memory_location = (uint16*) (KERNEL_START + 0xB8000);
00008 
00009 static unsigned int cursor_x = 0;
00010 static unsigned int cursor_y = 0;
00011 
00012 static terminal_t* current_terminal = 0;
00013 
00014 void text_mode_set_x(uint8 x) 
00015 {
00016         cursor_x = x;
00017         if (current_terminal)
00018                 current_terminal->m_cursorX = x;
00019 }
00020 
00021 void text_mode_set_y(uint8 y) 
00022 {
00023         cursor_y = y;
00024         if (current_terminal)
00025                 current_terminal->m_cursorY = y;
00026 }
00027 
00028 static const uint8 active_foreground_col = 15;
00029 static const uint8 active_background_col = 0;
00030 
00031 static void text_mode_move_cursor() 
00032 {
00033     // The screen is 80 characters wide...
00034     uint16 cursorLocation = cursor_y * 80 + cursor_x;
00035 
00036     outb(0x3D4, 14);                  // Tell the VGA board we are setting the high cursor byte.
00037     outb(0x3D5, cursorLocation >> 8); // Send the high cursor byte.
00038 
00039     outb(0x3D4, 15);                  // Tell the VGA board we are setting the low cursor byte.
00040     outb(0x3D5, cursorLocation);      // Send the low cursor byte.
00041 
00042 }
00043 
00044 void text_mode_scroll_prec(uint16* video_memory, unsigned char bgc, unsigned char fgc, unsigned int* cx, unsigned int* cy)
00045 {
00046     // Get a space character with the default colour attributes.
00047     uint8 attributeByte = (bgc << 4) | (fgc & 0x0F);
00048     uint16 blank = 0x20 /* space */ | (attributeByte << 8);
00049 
00050     // Row 25 is the end, this means we need to scroll up
00051     if(*cy >= 25)
00052     {
00053         // Move the current text chunk that makes up the screen
00054         // back in the buffer by a line
00055         int i;
00056         for (i = 0*80; i < 24*80; i++)
00057         {
00058             video_memory[i] = video_memory[i+80];
00059         }
00060 
00061         // The last line should now be blank. Do this by writing
00062         // 80 spaces to it.
00063         for (i = 24*80; i < 25*80; i++)
00064         {
00065             video_memory[i] = blank;
00066         }
00067 
00068         // The cursor should now be on the last line.
00069         *cy = 24;
00070     }
00071 }
00072 
00073 void text_mode_putc_prec(uint16* video_memory, uint8 bgc, uint8 fgc, unsigned int* cx, unsigned int* cy, char c)
00074 {
00075     // The attribute byte is made up of two nibbles - the lower being the 
00076     // foreground colour, and the upper the background colour.
00077     uint8  attributeByte = (bgc << 4) | (fgc & 0x0F);
00078 
00079     // The attribute byte is the top 8 bits of the word we have to send to the
00080     // VGA board.
00081     uint16 attribute = attributeByte << 8;
00082     uint16 *location = 0;
00083 
00084     // Handle a backspace, by moving the cursor back one space
00085     if (c == 0x08 && *cx)
00086     {
00087         *cx = *cx - 1;
00088     }
00089 
00090     // Handle a tab by increasing the cursor's X, but only to a point
00091     // where it is divisible by 8.
00092     else if (c == 0x09)
00093     {
00094         *cx = (*cx + 8) & ~(8-1);
00095     }
00096 
00097     // Handle carriage return
00098     else if (c == '\r')
00099     {
00100         *cx = 0;
00101     }
00102 
00103     // Handle newline by moving cursor back to left and increasing the row
00104     else if (c == '\n')
00105     {
00106         *cx = 0;
00107         *cy = *cy + 1;
00108     }
00109     // Handle any other printable character.
00110     else if(c >= ' ')
00111     {
00112         location = video_memory + ( (*cy) * 80 + (*cx));
00113         *location = c | attribute;
00114         *cx = *cx + 1;
00115     }
00116 
00117     // Check if we need to insert a new line because we have reached the end
00118     // of the screen.
00119     if (*cx >= 80)
00120     {
00121         *cx = 0;
00122         *cy = *cy + 1;
00123     }
00124 
00125     text_mode_scroll_prec(video_memory, bgc, fgc, cx, cy);
00126 }
00127 
00128 void text_mode_clearscreen_prec(uint16* video_memory, uint8 bgc, uint8 fgc, unsigned int* cx, unsigned int* cy) 
00129 {
00130     // Make an attribute byte for the default colours
00131     uint8 attributeByte = (bgc /*black*/ << 4) | (fgc /*white*/ & 0x0F);
00132     uint16 blank = 0x20 /* space */ | (attributeByte << 8);
00133 
00134     int i;
00135     for (i = 0; i < 80*25; i++)
00136     {
00137         video_memory[i] = blank;
00138     }
00139 
00140     // Move the hardware cursor back to the start.
00141     *cx = 0;
00142     *cy = 0;
00143 }
00144 
00145 void text_mode_clearscreen() 
00146 {
00147     text_mode_clearscreen_prec(video_memory_location, active_background_col, active_foreground_col, &cursor_x, &cursor_y);
00148     text_mode_move_cursor();
00149 }

00151 void text_mode_set_fg_color(uint8 col) 
00152 {
00153 }
00154 
00155 void text_mode_set_bg_color(uint8 col) 
00156 {
00157 }
00158 
00159 void text_mode_putc(char c) 
00160 {
00161     text_mode_putc_prec(video_memory_location, active_background_col, active_foreground_col, &cursor_x, &cursor_y, c);
00162 
00163     // Move the hardware cursor.
00164     text_mode_move_cursor();
00165 }
00166 
00167 void text_mode_hardwrite(const char * Array) 
00168 {
00169         unsigned int i = 0;
00170         while (Array[i]) {
00171                 text_mode_putc(Array[i++]);     
00172         }
00173 }
00174 
00175 void backup_terminal(terminal_t* term)
00176 {
00177         memcpy(term->m_backupData, video_memory_location, sizeof(uint16) * term->m_width * term->m_height);
00178 }
00179 
00180 void text_mode_tputc(terminal_t* term, char c)
00181 {
00182         text_mode_putc_prec(video_memory_location, term->m_backgroundColour, term->m_foregroundColour, &cursor_x, &cursor_y, c);
00183         term->m_cursorX = cursor_x;
00184         term->m_cursorY = cursor_y;
00185 
00186         text_mode_move_cursor();
00187 }
00188 
00189 void text_mode_tsetfg(terminal_t* term, uint8 col)
00190 {
00191         text_mode_set_fg_color(col);
00192 }
00193 
00194 void text_mode_tsetbg(terminal_t* term, uint8 col)
00195 {
00196         text_mode_set_bg_color(col);
00197 }
00198 
00199 void text_mode_tclear(terminal_t* term)
00200 {
00201     text_mode_clearscreen_prec(video_memory_location, term->m_backgroundColour, term->m_foregroundColour, &cursor_x, &cursor_y);
00202     text_mode_move_cursor();
00203 }
00204 
00205 void text_mode_tup(terminal_t* term)
00206 {
00207         cursor_x = term->m_cursorX;
00208         cursor_y = term->m_cursorY;
00209 
00210         text_mode_move_cursor();
00211 }
00212 
00213 void text_mode_sett(terminal_t* term)
00214 {
00215         if (current_terminal != 0)
00216                 backup_terminal(current_terminal);
00217 
00218         current_terminal = 0;
00219         term->m_used = 1;
00220 
00221         if (term->m_height != 25 || term->m_width != 80)
00222         {
00223                 //Incompatable with this terminal
00224                 current_terminal = 0;
00225                 text_mode_clearscreen();
00226                 return; //Crash
00227         }
00228 
00229         text_mode_clearscreen();
00230         
00231         //Restore from backed up data
00232         memcpy(video_memory_location, term->m_backupData, sizeof(uint16) * term->m_width * term->m_height);
00233 
00234         text_mode_tup(term);
00235 
00236         current_terminal = term;
00237 }
